page.title: 16BALMEDIE MUSHROOM FARM
page.content: In Balmedie there is a mushroom farm. It is the only inhabited farm in our immediate area and has 17 staff (12 ladies and 5 men). The ladies pick the mushrooms, and the men prepare compost and sow seeds. It wasn't a mushroom farm until 1978. Before that time it was only a farm building. They have asbestos sheets on the roof and special trays in which they prepare the mushrooms. The mushrooms need compost to grow. They need to be watered once a week in summer and twice a week in winter. Mushrooms to grow well need chicken and horse manure. Mushrooms need an atmosphere with a temperature of 60F. Mushrooms are usually 5cms high and 5cms across the top. Before you eat them you must wash them carefully in water and then fry them gently in butter.
